# duration

**Instance Property**

The activity’s duration, measured in seconds.

## Declaration

```swift
var duration: TimeInterval { get }
```

## Discussion

HealthKit calculates the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKWorkoutActivity/duration] as the elapsed time between the activity’s [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKWorkoutActivity/startDate] and [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKWorkoutActivity/endDate], ignoring any pause periods. If an activity is currently in progress, it has a `nil`-valued [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKWorkoutActivity/endDate]. In this case, HealthKit calculates the duration as the time between the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKWorkoutActivity/startDate] and the current time, ignoring any pause periods.

## Accessing workout data

- **uuid**: The activity’s universally unique identifier (UUID).
- **startDate**: The activitiy’s start date and time.
- **endDate**: The activity’s end date and time.
- **allStatistics**: A dictionary that contains all the statistics for the activity.
- **statistics(for:)**: Returns the activity’s statistics for the provided quantity type.
- **metadata**: Metadata that describes the activity.
- **workoutConfiguration**: The configuration information for this part of the workout.
- **workoutEvents**: An array of events associated with the containing workout and occurring during the activity’s duration.
